rows.name: Agnes Underground
rows.description: Agnes Underground is a Capitol Hill coworking space that offers fixed desks, open seating, and a 10-person meeting area. They also have a workout room and shower.

rows.name: Ballard Labs
rows.description: Ballard Labs is based in Ballard (big surprise). They're a coworking space that offers open seating and fixed desks as well as private offices. This space is close to Edith MaceField's house.

rows.name: DevLocal
rows.address: 3601 Fremont Ave N Ste 300 Seattle, WA 98103
rows.description: /dev/local is a coworking space based in Fremont and focused on "software people." It's currently on hiatus. Update as of July 14, 2014: "DevLocal will be moving out of the Fremont space on 8/15. We are still in the process of locating a new space. Feel free to sign-up to join our mailing list and we'll notify you once we have sorted this out!" Most interesting feature: an Open Device Lab where you can test out your apps and websites on multiple devices.

rows.name: Impact Hub Seattle
rows.description: Based in Pioneer Square, Impact Hub Seattle is a coworking space focused on socially-conscious companies. There's open seating as well as fixed desks and many meeting rooms and phone booths. Recently expanded to include a new space for private offices in the Seattle location, and added a Kirkland location as well.

rows.name: Indie Ballard
rows.description: Located in an historic brick building in Ballard, Indie Ballard offers shared and fixed desks. The Ballard Public Library is a few blocks away, as well as all the wonderful bars of Ballard.

rows.name: Makers
rows.description: A coworking space in Belltown with a great open layout.

rows.name: Office Nomads
rows.description: A coworking space in Capitol Hill.

rows.name: Surf Incubator
rows.description: A coworking and office space in downtown Seattle.

rows.name: Thinkspace (Fremont)
rows.description: A coworking space in Fremont. There's also one in Redmond.

rows.name: WeWork
rows.description: A South Lake Union coworking space. Part of a national company.

rows.name: ALTSpace
rows.description: Part coworking, part maker space, ALTspace is located in Seattle's Central District.

rows.name: Collective Self
rows.description: A home in the Central District opened to coworking! It's open on Wednesdays, 9:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m., and other days by appointment.

rows.name: Makerhaus
rows.description: Closing on September 16, 2014 after 18 months. A warehouse-like maker space for designers of physical objects in “Frelard”. 3D printers, lasercutters, and other fabrication tools fill the space to help you create your prototype. You can take classes to learn about new topics and tools.

rows.name: Metrix Create:Space
rows.description: A maker space on Broadway in Capitol Hill. All the awesome tools you've probably wanted to use. Free coffee and wifi! Plus if you become a member there's special members-only wifi and other important benefits.

rows.name: Red Element Collective
rows.description: Coworking with a special focus on filmmakers.

rows.name: Vybe Communication Hub
rows.description: A coworking space nestled in with a bunch of other office services on Eastlake Ave.

rows.name: Dockside Solutions
rows.description: Right on Shilshole, this small shared office space offers mail services for travelers. With very limited capacity and no marine view, it’s less collaborative co-working and more of a quiet desk rental with easy access to mail services, nearby coffee bar, and walks along Shilshole marina. Call the owner Angie for more info.

rows.name: Lilospace
rows.description: This one is in the old Rainer Brewery Building. A standard rate, with lease or no lease, for a flexible, bright (no joke) office space. Located in the heart of the Rainier Brewery Building, follow the small signs up the ramp, across from Tully’s. Admit it: you want to work in that building. lil'ospace is probably your chance.

rows.name: My Branch Office
rows.description: A coworking space on Capitol Hill. Previously The Mill.

rows.name: Office Junction
rows.address: 6040 B California Ave SW Seattle, WA 98136
rows.description: The only coworking space in West Seattle offers a view of Puget Sound from their rooftop patio. The owners are on-site.

rows.name: Works Progress Coworking
rows.description: This coworking space has a collection of old desks from places like the Re-Store and UW surplus and a cool dog named Bailey. They expanded this year to include a new space with hardwood floors and a kitchen. The expansion doubles as an event space in the evenings. Works Progress feels at home in Greenwood. It's near the shops and restaurants at 85th and Greenwood, has some parking available, and has a quiet, comfortable environment.

rows.name: Seattle Attic
rows.description: A feminist hacker/textile fabrication/3-D printing space on Capitol Hill. From their website: "The Seattle Attic Community Workshop is a space for all women, cis and trans*, where we make our world into a place that fits us better."

rows.name: Jigsaw Renaissance
rows.description: A maker space in the International District with a wide range of activities and members. It's a hectic and inclusive space with reasonably-priced membership rates. Hackathons, workshops, and other events are often held at Jigsaw.

rows.name: The Collaboratory
rows.description: From the website: "Our mission is to create an instrument of transformation that provides a built environment and programming specifically designed to create community and equip change-makers.  The Collaboratory is housed in a multi-use complex that incorporates four unique spaces: the mixing chamber, the coworking office, the learning kitchen, and the community park & garden."
